channel.title: MyCatholicVillage Community Call
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/
channel.description:
Are you Catholic or intersted in Catholicism? Members of MyCatholicVillage.com and other Catholics join the Community Call to discuss the Catholic faith, saint of the day, prayers, Catholic news and more! Anyone is welcome to join the call or chat or just listen to the audio stream. If you miss a call be sure to download or listen to our community calls!
Music by www.pacdv.com/sounds/ This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com
channel.itunes:author: Mike154
channel.itunes:subtitle: MyCatholicVillage Community Call
channel.itunes:summary:
Are you Catholic or intersted in Catholicism? Members of MyCatholicVillage.com and other Catholics join the Community Call to discuss the Catholic faith, saint of the day, prayers, Catholic news and more! Anyone is welcome to join the call or chat or just listen to the audio stream. If you miss a call be sure to download or listen to our community calls!
Music by www.pacdv.com/sounds/ This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

item.title: EPISODE47 - Coadjutor Archbishop Gomez
item.author: info@talkshoe.com
item.description: We discuss Coadjutor Archbishop Gomez who is being welcomed to Los Angeles. As Coadjutor, Archbishop Gomez, 58, will automatically become head of the three-county Archdiocese of Los Angeles upon Cardinal Mahony's retirement at age 75 on Feb. 27, 2011. Archbishop Gomez is the first Latino Archbishop of Los Angeles and the third Mexican native to serve as a Los Angeles bishop (the others: Bishop Francisco Garcia Diego y Moreno, the first bishop of both Californias, and current San Gabriel Region Auxiliary Bishop Gabino Zavala).
item.itunes:author: Mike154
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE47 - Coadjutor Archbishop Gomez
item.itunes:summary: We discuss Coadjutor Archbishop Gomez who is being welcomed to Los Angeles. As Coadjutor, Archbishop Gomez, 58, will automatically become head of the three-county Archdiocese of Los Angeles upon Cardinal Mahony's retirement at age 75 on Feb. 27, 2011. Archbishop Gomez is the first Latino Archbishop of Los Angeles and the third Mexican native to serve as a Los Angeles bishop (the others: Bishop Francisco Garcia Diego y Moreno, the first bishop of both Californias, and current San Gabriel Region Auxiliary Bishop Gabino Zavala).

item.title: EPISODE34 - Unborn Jesus Prayer Hour
item.author: info@talkshoe.com
item.description: Join us as we pray the Way of the Incarnation and other prayers. Our prayers are offered as part of "The Great Prayer Project - End Abortion" - see www.luke181.com. Pedro will be leading us in this prayer hour. We will meet on the 25th of every month at 9 pm pacific time for one year starting March 25, 2010.
item.itunes:author: Mike154

item.title: EPISODE40 - St. Joseph
item.author: info@talkshoe.com
item.description: Carol, Mike and Pedro discuss the saint of the day -- St. Joseph. Also - a statement from the Catholic Bishops on the reform of health care. In addition we discuss Luke181.com (prayer site for an end to abortion).
item.itunes:author: Mike154
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE40 - St. Joseph
item.itunes:summary: Carol, Mike and Pedro discuss the saint of the day -- St. Joseph. Also - a statement from the Catholic Bishops on the reform of health care. In addition we discuss Luke181.com (prayer site for an end to abortion).

item.title: EPISODE43 - Los Angeles March for Life (Part 3)
item.author: info@talkshoe.com
item.description: In part 3 of our live broadcast from the 7th Annual March for Life we hear from several women testify about their abortion experiences. These women are part of a group called "Silent No More".
item.itunes:author: Mike154
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE43 - Los Angeles March for Life (Part 3)
item.itunes:summary: In part 3 of our live broadcast from the 7th Annual March for Life we hear from several women testify about their abortion experiences. These women are part of a group called "Silent No More".

item.title: EPISODE41 - Los Angeles March for Life Part 1
item.author: info@talkshoe.com
item.description: Live broadcast from the 7th Annual Los Angeles March for Life. We were transmitting via cell phone so our apologies for any audio quality issues. The call opens up with speakers at the event which included Reverend Walter Hoye and Lila Rose, as well as Fr. Peter West of Priests for Life.

item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE41 - Los Angeles March for Life Part 1

item.title: EPISODE14 - Interview: Jeff from the Catholic Band "Simple Servants"
item.author: info@talkshoe.com
item.description: Interview with singer songwriter and guitarist Jeff from the Catholic Band "Simple Servants". We discuss with Jeff how he got into performing Catholic music. We also discuss and play two of the songs that Jeff wrote and peformed..."Speak for Me" and "Hail Mary". After the interview with Jeff stay tuned to listen to another song Jeff wrote named "Raise your Hands up High".
item.itunes:author: Mike154
item.itunes:subtitle: EPISODE14 - Interview: Jeff from the Catholic Band "Simple Servants"
item.itunes:summary: Interview with singer songwriter and guitarist Jeff from the Catholic Band "Simple Servants". We discuss with Jeff how he got into performing Catholic music. We also discuss and play two of the songs that Jeff wrote and peformed..."Speak for Me" and "Hail Mary". After the interview with Jeff stay tuned to listen to another song Jeff wrote named "Raise your Hands up High".
